page.title: 07Education in Hexham.
page.content: Catholic families in Tynedale.Buses transport the country children,who have lunch,cooked at the Sele school,and brought over in containers.School uniform is light blue and dark blue. {Hexham Middle School}is in 2 buildings on a common site.One building,built in 1909,was previously the{Queen {Elizabeth Grammar}School,and the other brick building,built in 1935,was previously{Hexham Secondary Modern School.Children from local first schools transfer here at 9+,where 26 full-time and 2 part-time teachers teach 503 children for 4 years,when they move on to Q.E.H.S.The uniform is red and grey. {St.Josephs R.C.Middle}is in Highford lane.It is a modern building erected in 1974 for 208 children aged 9 to 13 who come from Hexham and district on
